parameters.name: Propagate
parameters.description: True propagates the swept cut to the next edge, false causes the swept cut to occur only on the selected edge; to propagate to the next edge, the next edge must be tangent to the current edge

parameters.name: Alignment
parameters.description: If the curve used to sweep goes from one face to another or from one edge to another, then passing True causes the sweep to cut completely through the end faces of the cut, false causes the swept cut to begin and end perpendicular to the sweep curve; therefore, it may not break through the two end faces of the body being cut

parameters.name: TwistCtrlOption
parameters.description: Twist control options as defined by swTwistControlType_e

parameters.name: KeepTangency
parameters.description: If the sweep section has tangent segments, True to cause the corresponding surfaces in the resulting sweep to be tangent, false to not

parameters.name: BAdvancedSmoothing
parameters.description: If the sweep section has circular or elliptical arcs, true to approximate the sections and smooth the surfaces, false to not

parameters.name: StartMatchingType
parameters.description: Tangency type as defined by swTangencyType_e

parameters.name: EndMatchingType
parameters.description: Tangency type as defined by swTangencyType_e

parameters.name: IsThinBody
parameters.description: True if this feature is a thin body, false if not

parameters.name: Thickness1
parameters.description: Thickness value for the first direction

parameters.name: Thickness2
parameters.description: Thickness value for the second direction

parameters.name: ThinType
parameters.description: Thin wall type as defined by swThinWallType_e

parameters.name: PathAlign
parameters.description: Align path type (see Remarks )

parameters.name: UseFeatScope
parameters.description: True if the feature only affects selected bodies, false if the feature affects all bodies

parameters.name: UseAutoSelect
parameters.description: True to automatically select all bodies and have the feature affect those bodies, false to select the bodies the feature affects (see Remarks )

parameters.name: TwistAngle
parameters.description: If twistCtrlOption set to swTwistControlConstantTwistAlongPath, then specify end twist angle

parameters.name: BMergeSmoothFaces
parameters.description: True to merge smooth faces, false to not

remarks:
Use
IModelDocExtension::SelectByID2
to select the profile and sweep curves. The mark for:
1 = Profile selection
2 = Guide-curve selection, if provided
4 = Sweep path
The PathAlign argument is available when TwistCtrlOption is set to 0 and can take one of these values:
0 = None; no correction (default)
2 = Direction vector; a plane, planar face, or line defines the path
3 = All faces; includes neighboring faces
When UseAutoSelect is false, the user must select the bodies that the feature will affect.
When using cut or cavity features that result in multiple bodies, you cannot select to keep all of the resulting bodies or one or more selected bodies.
